p: Intracellular production of ROS in pathogens was measured using DCFH-DA (2′,7′-dichlorodihydrofluorescein diacetate) probe. The fungal mycelia were obtained as described in Section 4.7 and were incubated with 20 µM DCFH-DA at 30 °C for 30 min in a dark environment. The hyphae were washed with phosphate buffer (0.1 M; pH 7.0) twice and were disrupted in the same buffer with acid-washed glass beads (425–600 μm diameter) by tissue homogenizer (Tissuelyer-48, Jingxin Technologies, Shanghai, China) for 3 min. The mixture was centrifuged at 10,000 g, 4 °C for 5 min. The supernatant was analyzed at λ excitation = 485 nm and λ emission = 535 nm by a fluorescence microplate reader (Spark 10M, Tecan, Mannedorf, Switzerland).
